track.name: Dreamers [Music from the FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 Official Soundtrack]

album.title: Dreamers [Music from the FIFA World Cup Qatar 2022 Official Soundtrack]

wiki.summary: "Dreamers" is a 2022 song by South Korean singer Jungkook, a member of the boy band BTS. The song was recorded as a part of a promotional album for the 2022 FIFA World Cup. The song features backing vocals from Qatari singer Fahad Al Kubaisi. The song was released on November 20 to coincide with the first match of that year's FIFA World Cup and its opening ceremonies. On November 19, Jungkook would announce that he would debut the song at the opening ceremonies of the 2022 FIFA World Cup on November 20. Read more on Last.fm.
wiki.content: "Dreamers" is a 2022 song by South Korean singer Jungkook, a member of the boy band BTS. The song was recorded as a part of a promotional album for the 2022 FIFA World Cup. The song features backing vocals from Qatari singer Fahad Al Kubaisi. The song was released on November 20 to coincide with the first match of that year's FIFA World Cup and its opening ceremonies. On November 19, Jungkook would announce that he would debut the song at the opening ceremonies of the 2022 FIFA World Cup on November 20. The performance featured Jungkook in an all-black suit surrounded by background dancers, being joined by Al Kubaisi midway through the performance. Along with the November 19 announcement, a music video for the song was announced, with a scheduled release date of November 22 with the video being released on FIFA's YouTube channel. “Dreamers” was performed live at FIFA World Cup opening ceremony on November 20, 2022. The song received positive reception from BTS' fanbase, the ARMY. Within a day of the song's official release, the song had charted to number one in at least 102 different regions on the iTunes charts. The song has reached No.1 on iTunes Song Chart in over 100 countries and regions, including the US, UK, and Australia, becoming the first and only FIFA World Cup song to do so (and in less than 12 hours of release). It also topped iTunes Worldwide Song Chart. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
